alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Cherokee; Etowah; St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 11:15PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN CALHOUN...ETOWAH... NORTHEASTERN ST. CLAIR AND CHEROKEE COUNTIES THROUGH MIDNIGHT CST... At 1114 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Neely Henry Lake, or 7 miles southeast of Rainbow City, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Jacksonville, Rainbow City, Attalla, Piedmont, Hokes Bluff, Centre, Cedar Bluff, Forney, Centre Municipal Airport, Glencoe, Ragland, Ohatchee, Steele, Leesburg, Reece City, Sand Rock, Gaylesville, Cherokee Rock Village, and Pleasant Gap. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for northeastern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CST for central and east central Alabama.
